blocks.value: St. Rose of Viterbo was born in 1233 in Viterbo, Italy. From a young age, she showed extraordinary holiness and love for God. At the age of 8, she had a vision of the Blessed Virgin Mary, who told her to join the Third Order of St. Francis and to preach penance to the people.

Rose preached in the streets of Viterbo, calling people to repentance and to support the Pope against the Emperor. Despite her young age, her words moved many to conversion. Rose died at the age of 17 in 1251. She was canonized by Pope Callixtus III. Her body remains incorrupt.
